docs.abstract: The coronavirus spread and its economic effects are stressing the U.S. system for the first time since the 2008 financial crisis.
docs.snippet: The coronavirus spread and its economic effects are stressing the U.S. system for the first time since the 2008 financial crisis.
docs.lead_paragraph: The investor Warren Buffett once gave a famous warning: “It’s only when the tide goes out that you learn who’s been swimming naked.”

headline.main: It’s a ‘Swimming Naked’ Moment: The Financial System Has a Real Test
headline.print_headline: Swift Shocks Put System To the Test

docs.abstract: Secret labs. Magic cures. Government plots. Despite efforts by social media companies to stop it, false information about the coronavirus is proliferating around the world.
docs.snippet: Secret labs. Magic cures. Government plots. Despite efforts by social media companies to stop it, false information about the coronavirus is proliferating around the world.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — First, there were conspiratorial whispers on social media that the coronavirus had been cooked up in a secret government lab in China. Then there were bogus medicines: gels, liquids and powders that immunized against the virus.

headline.main: Surge of Virus Misinformation Stumps Facebook and Twitter
headline.print_headline: Misinformation Surge on Coronavirus Stumps Facebook and Twitter

byline.original: By Sheera Frenkel, Davey Alba and Raymond Zhong

docs.abstract: The senator’s sweeping critique of coverage has more merit than we in the media like to admit.
docs.snippet: The senator’s sweeping critique of coverage has more merit than we in the media like to admit.
docs.lead_paragraph: When a BuzzFeed News colleague and I sat down with Bernie Sanders in his Capitol Hill office in 2015, he started with a thank you — for doing what you do to provide an alternative to the corporate media.

headline.main: What Bernie Sanders Gets Right About the Media
headline.print_headline: Sanders Has a Point: We Need Alternatives

docs.abstract: The country’s clampdown on public life has left businesses reeling. As the government pledges support, a restaurateur prepares to hunker down.
docs.snippet: The country’s clampdown on public life has left businesses reeling. As the government pledges support, a restaurateur prepares to hunker down.
docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS — Xavier Denamur is used to bustling between the five popular bistros he owns in the Marais neighborhood of central Paris, managing a team of nearly 70 waiters and chefs and keeping tabs on the phalanx of patrons who crowd his tables, elbow-to-elbow, year round.

headline.main: France’s Bistros Close, in a Frenzy of Donated Cheese and Pâté
headline.print_headline: Free Cheese and Pâté as France’s Bistros Shutter

docs.abstract: A week ago, U.S. airlines said they could absorb the costs of the coronavirus outbreak. Now, they’ve approached the government for help. More will follow.
docs.snippet: A week ago, U.S. airlines said they could absorb the costs of the coronavirus outbreak. Now, they’ve approached the government for help. More will follow.
docs.lead_paragraph: Want this in your inbox each morning? Sign up here.

headline.main: Here Come the Bailouts, Starting With the Airlines

docs.abstract: Recent commercial real estate transactions in New York.
docs.snippet: Recent commercial real estate transactions in New York.

docs.abstract: The fast-spreading virus has put an end to movies, date nights and other economic activity, prompting some economists to call a U.S. recession.
docs.snippet: The fast-spreading virus has put an end to movies, date nights and other economic activity, prompting some economists to call a U.S. recession.
docs.lead_paragraph: In some places, public officials and private business owners moved with stunning speed. In others, paralyzing hesitancy, defiant bravado or blithe disregard dominated. But by Monday, it was clear everywhere that most of the American economy was grinding to an unparalleled halt and would remain that way for months.

headline.main: America’s Economy Begins to Shut Down as Pandemic Measures Take Hold
headline.print_headline: Crisis Shutting Down Commerce, Likely for Months

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

byline.original: By Patricia Cohen and Jim Tankersley

docs.abstract: The multiplexes are closed. Marvel’s “Black Widow” is postponed. And the National Association of Theater Owners is asking for relief.
docs.snippet: The multiplexes are closed. Marvel’s “Black Widow” is postponed. And the National Association of Theater Owners is asking for relief.
docs.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — With movie theaters across the country shutting their doors and furloughing the majority of their hourly workers, the National Association of Theater Owners asked Congress and the Trump administration on Wednesday for relief measures meant to help multiplexes stay solvent until business can resume.

headline.main: Movie Theater Owners: We Need a Bailout, Too
headline.print_headline: Movie Theaters Want Relief As Most Screens Go Dark

byline.original: By Nicole Sperling and Brooks Barnes

docs.abstract: The Federal Reserve has moved quickly to combat economic fallout from the coronavirus pandemic, but President Trump’s ongoing attacks may have weakened its message.
docs.snippet: The Federal Reserve has moved quickly to combat economic fallout from the coronavirus pandemic, but President Trump’s ongoing attacks may have weakened its message.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump has spent two years publicly attacking the Federal Reserve and undercutting its chair, Jerome H. Powell. That animosity is making it difficult for Washington to project a united front as it stares down the most significant economic threat since the Great Recession.

headline.main: How Trump’s Attacks on the Fed Have Made Its Job Harder
headline.print_headline: Trump’s Attacks on the Fed Undercut a United Front in Washington

byline.original: By Jeanna Smialek, Jim Tankersley and Alan Rappeport

docs.abstract: Businesses are grappling with how to deal with a potential outbreak. Here’s what they’re doing, and how it could affect their workers.
docs.snippet: Businesses are grappling with how to deal with a potential outbreak. Here’s what they’re doing, and how it could affect their workers.
docs.lead_paragraph: Furloughs. Sick leave. Working from home.

headline.main: Working From Home: How Coronavirus Could Affect the Workplace
headline.print_headline: Advice on Coronavirus and the Workplace
